derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the late Latin sense): from French patriote, from late Latin patriota 'fellow countryman', from Greek patriōtēs, from patrios 'of one's fathers', from patris 'fatherland'

entry.def: Someone who is a patriot loves their country and feels very loyal towards it.

example.ex: They were staunch British patriots and had portraits of the Queen in their flat.
example.tran: 他们是英国坚定的爱国者，并在公寓里挂着女王的肖像。

means.word_mean: 1. one who loves and defends his or her country

stems_affixes.word_buile: patri祖国[比喻成父亲]+ot名词字尾,表示人→n.爱国者,爱国主义者
pil+ot……人→意大利语piloto"划桨"的变体
zeal热心+ot……人→n.狂热分子,热心者
pil+ot……人→意大利语piloto"划桨"的变体

stems_affixes.value_cn: 家长的;族长的;家长似的
stems_affixes.word_buile: patriarch家长+al……的→adj.家长的;族长的;家长似的
patri父,祖+arch统治者,首脑,长→n.家长;族长
patri父亲+archy统治者→n.家长,父系社会
patri父亲+mony状态或物→父亲留下的物品→遗产
patri祖国[比喻成父亲]+ot人→n.爱国者,爱国主义者
patriot爱国+ism主义→n.爱国主义;爱国心
ex出+patri祖国+ate表动词→出祖国→驱逐出国
re重新+patri祖国+ate表动词→重新回到祖国
